# Diatonic Chords

Chords in the scales below are constructed using intervals of 3rds. E.g., in the C major scale (C, D, E, F, G, A, B), the C triad is constructed using C, E, G.

## Major Scale {-}
The major scale contains the following intervals: W W H W W W H


```{r echo=FALSE}
library(kableExtra)
odf <- t(data.frame(A = c("1", "2", "3", "4", "5", "6", "7"),
                    B = c("I", "ii", "iii", "IV", "V", "vi", "vii\u00B0"),
                    C = c("Tonic", "Supertonic", "Mediant", "Submediant", "Dominant", "Submediant", "Leading Tone"),
                    D = c("maj", "min", "min", "maj", "maj", "min", "dim"),
                    E = c("Maj7", "m7", "m7", "Maj7", "dom7", "min7", "m7b5"),
                    G = c("CMaj7", "Dm7", "Em7", "FMaj7", "G7", "Am7", "Bm7b5")))

rownames(odf) <- c("Scale Notes", "Chord RNs", "Functional Names", "Triads", "7th Chords", "Example in C")

odf %>%
  kbl(caption = "Major Scale - Diatonic Chords",
      align = "r", booktabs = TRUE) %>%
  kable_styling(font_size = 13) %>%
  column_spec(1, bold = TRUE)

```
